tp1_general_rule_1: 1- Wudu is not required for shaving or trimming.
tp1_general_rule_2: 2- It is not necessary to perform trimming immediately after Sa‘i.
tp1_general_rule_3: 3- Shaving or trimming may be performed anywhere.
tp1_male_item:
Shaving: Removing (shaving) the hair of the head.

Trimming: Shortening some hair from the head, beard, or mustache.
tp1_female_item: Trimming: Shortening some hair from the head.
tp2_main_rule: A person in ihram may perform trimming themselves or have it done by someone who is not in a state of ihram. Therefore, until you have performed your own trimming, you may not perform trimming for others.
tp3_ignorance_or_mistake_note: You may choose between mistake and negligence.
halq_intention:
Intention: I perform shaving (Halq) for my Umrah Mufradah / as a proxy, seeking closeness to Allah.
(If it is a proxy Umrah.)
halq_shaving_method:
After that, they should shave their head themselves or have it shaved by someone who is not in a state of ihram.
It is recommended to begin shaving from the right side of the head.
halq_shaving_dua:
While shaving, recite:
“O Allah, grant me light for every hair on the Day of Resurrection.”
taqsir_intention:
Intention:
I perform shortening (Taqsir) for my Umrah Mufradah / as a proxy, seeking closeness to Allah.
taqsir_method: After that, cut a small amount of the hair of your head, beard, or mustache, either yourself or by someone who is not in a state of ihram.
